alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Central Mountains; Sevier Valley; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 28 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garfield...Piute...southwestern Sevier...eastern Beaver and northeastern Iron Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 254 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Cove Fort to near Panguitch. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Richfield, Junction, Monroe, Panguitch, Annabella, Marysvale, Antimony, Sevier, Elsinore, Circleville, Glenwood, Joseph, Kingston, Angle and Hillsdale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 8 and 34. US Route 89 between mile markers 125 and 191. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
